column4: is there a way to freeze your version of ubuntu so no upgrade or kernel updates take place?
because whenever I run Maverick Meerkat Ubuntu 10.10
everything is working PERFECTLY off the fresh install, but I have had 2 computer crashes
I will check that out thanks
Natty and Oneiric have made me a sad panda
remember, normally updates are for security-issues
what do you mean?
if you dont update your system (update != upgrade) you dont get security fixes
you dont have to go to 11.04 or 11.10 but you should install updates for 10.10 (which is the default option)
these updates dont change functions, just fixing security issues
okay, so as long as sources.list points to maverick and I don't upgrade, I shouldn't get new kernel versions?
correct only patchlevel-kernel-updates
e.g. 2.6.35-13 instead of 2.6.35-12 but never 2.6.38-x
ah, okay so that is what those mean...I can do that via synaptic or aptitude?
both
doesnt matter if you use synaptic, software-center,apt-get or aptitude, all of them are only installing sec-updates (but asking if you want 11.04)
so a normal "sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade" will NOT change your ubuntu-version and is recommend for the security updates
I am currently setting synaptic to prefer version maverick-security, that shoudl do the trick, right?
yes
thanks a bunch
also there is something like "dont look for release-upgrades"
the only options I saw under "prefer cersions from: were: maverick, maverick-security, and maverick updates
